quiz.title: Economics: Fixed Inputs, Demand Curves, Competition, and Budget Line

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a fixed input?
questions.explanation: Equipment (machinery, buildings) is typically a fixed input in the short run—its quantity cannot be changed quickly.

questions.question: If regardless of changes in its price, the quantity demanded of a commodity remains unchanged, then the demand curve for the commodity will be:
questions.explanation: Quantity demanded constant despite price changes means perfectly inelastic demand, which is represented by a vertical demand curve.

questions.question: For a perfect competition in the market:
options: Marginal revenue curve always slopes upward
Marginal revenue curve always slopes downward
Marginal revenue is always equal to average revenue
Marginal revenue is always less than average revenue
questions.explanation: In perfect competition, each firm faces a horizontal demand curve at the market price, so P = AR = MR (marginal revenue equals average revenue).

questions.question: The budget line is also known as the:
questions.explanation: The budget line (or budget constraint) shows all combinations of goods a consumer can afford given income and prices—hence 'consumption possibility line'.
